Summary: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime and surveillance society.
Author: George Orwell

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Summary: A story of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.
Author: Harper Lee

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Summary: A romantic novel about manners, upbringing, morality, and marriage in British society.
Author: Jane Austen

Title: Moby Dick
Summary: A seafaring narrative about obsession and revenge on a giant white whale.
Author: Herman Melville

Title: The Great Gatsby
Summary: A critique of the American Dream through the life of Jay Gatsby.
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Title: War and Peace
Summary: An epic historical novel about Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Summary: A young man's journey through life and his disdain for adulthood and hypocrisy.
Author: J.D. Salinger

Title: Brave New World
Summary: A futuristic novel exploring a utopian society sustained by scientific advancements and control.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Title: Crime and Punishment
Summary: A psychological exploration of crime, guilt, and redemption in 19th-century Russia.
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

Title: Jane Eyre
Summary: A young woman's journey of self-discovery, love, and independence.
Author: Charlotte Brontë

Title: Animal Farm
Summary: An allegorical novella reflecting on the Russian Revolution and its aftermath.
Author: George Orwell

Title: The Hobbit
Summary: A fantasy adventure about a hobbit's journey to reclaim a lost treasure.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Title: The Lord of the Rings
Summary: An epic saga of friendship, courage, and the fight against darkness in Middle-earth.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Summary: A young wizard's introduction to the magical world and his destiny.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Title: A Tale of Two Cities
Summary: A historical novel set during the French Revolution.
Author: Charles Dickens

Title: The Odyssey
Summary: An ancient Greek epic poem about Odysseus's journey home after the Trojan War.
Author: Homer

Title: Frankenstein
Summary: A Gothic tale of a scientist who creates a living being, leading to tragedy.
Author: Mary Shelley

Title: Wuthering Heights
Summary: A story of passionate but doomed love on the Yorkshire moors.
Author: Emily Brontë

Title: Great Expectations
Summary: The story of an orphan's growth and search for identity in Victorian England.
Author: Charles Dickens

Title: The Alchemist
Summary: A philosophical tale about following one's dreams and discovering one's destiny.
Author: Paulo Coelho
